result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevor J Hovde

records.addlTxt:
9:18 AM Defendant Trevor J Hovde in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Trevor J Hovde.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. This matter is tagging along with the defendant's felony matter.
Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:34 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Trevor J Hovde in court. Attorney Mark Emil Kershek not in court.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing November 1, 2022. (BC)

10:00 AM Defendant Trevor J Hovde in court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing November 1, 2022.  Court sets matter for status of counsel.  Defendant to report to the business center after court today.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Filed by the defendant - filed in 22CF1497 and copied to 22CM1708.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

2:23 PM Defendant Trevor J Hovde in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula, as a friend of the court.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
